Study_Title: Effects of Electromagnetic Fields on Cells: Physiological and Therapeutical Approaches and Molecular Mechanisms of Interaction
Authors: Richard H.W. Funk, Thomas K. Monsees
Summary: This study explores how electromagnetic fields (EMFs) influence cellular functions, discussing both physiological and therapeutic effects, including potential mechanisms at the molecular level.

Study_Title: The Effect of Bioelectromagnetic Therapy on Pain
Summary: The article discusses the role of resonance signaling in bioelectromagnetic medicine and how specific frequencies can modulate cellular functions to alleviate pain and promote healing.

Study_Title: Evidence-Based Use of Pulsed Electromagnetic Field Therapy in Clinical Plastic Surgery
Summary: This review evaluates the efficacy of pulsed electromagnetic field (PEMF) therapy in clinical plastic surgery, particularly its role in managing postsurgical pain and edema, highlighting the need for more evidence-based research.

Study_Title: V-EMF Therapy: A New Painless and Completely Non-Invasive Treatment for Striae Gravidarum
Authors: Sheila Veronese, Pier Antonio Bacci, Victor Garcia-Gimenez
Summary: The study presents V-EMF therapy, which combines vacuum and electromagnetic fields, as an effective non-invasive treatment for stretch marks (striae gravidarum), demonstrating significant skin regeneration and cosmetic improvement.

Study_Title: Pulsed Electromagnetic Fields (PEMF) Promote Early Wound Healing and Myofibroblast Proliferation in Diabetic Rats
Authors: Gladys Lai-Ying Cheing, Xiaohui Li, Lin Huang, Rachel Lai-Chu Kwan, Kwok-Kuen Cheung
Summary: This research indicates that PEMF therapy can enhance early wound healing and stimulate myofibroblast proliferation in diabetic rats, suggesting potential applications in improving diabetic wound healing in humans.

Study_Title: Therapeutic Effects of Whole-Body Devices Applying Pulsed Electromagnetic Fields (PEMF): A Systematic Literature Review
Summary: The systematic review assesses the therapeutic effects of whole-body PEMF devices across various conditions, finding insufficient evidence to recommend their use and highlighting the need for further high-quality, double-blind trials.

Study_Title: Electromagnetic Therapy for Treating Pressure Ulcers
Summary: This Cochrane review evaluates the efficacy of electromagnetic therapy in treating pressure ulcers, concluding that there is no sufficient evidence to support its effectiveness in healing such wounds.

Study_Title: V-EMF Treatment of Facial Scar: First Results
Authors: Sheila Veronese, Annalisa Beatini, Claudio Urbani, Eliana Lanza, Oscar Mosquera Paz
Summary: The study reports initial positive outcomes of using V-EMF therapy for treating facial scars, indicating improvements in scar appearance and patient satisfaction.

Study_Title: Vacuum and Electromagnetic Field in Synergy for Skin Rejuvenation: A Retrospective Study on 217 Patients
Authors: Simona Laura, Sheila Veronese, Giovanni Alberti, Pier Antonio Bacci, Annalisa Beatini
Summary: This retrospective study demonstrates that the combination of vacuum and electromagnetic field therapy effectively promotes skin rejuvenation, with significant improvements observed in a large patient cohort.

Study_Title: Vacuum and Electromagnetic Fields Treatment to Regenerate a Diffuse Mature Facial Scar Caused by Sulfuric Acid Assault
Authors: Sheila Veronese, Bruno Brunetti, Anna Minichino, Andrea Sbarbati
Summary: The case study highlights the successful use of combined vacuum and electromagnetic field therapy in regenerating severe facial scars caused by sulfuric acid burns, suggesting a promising non-invasive treatment option for extensive scarring.

Study_Title: The Synergy Between Vacuum and Electromagnetic Fields in the Treatment of Striae Distensae: Retrospective Study on 917 Patients with Clinical and Histological Case Records
Authors: Pier Antonio Bacci, Giovanni Alberti, Daniele Amuso, Andrea Artigiani, Victor Benitez Roig
Summary: This extensive retrospective study indicates that the combination of vacuum and electromagnetic fields is effective in treating stretch marks (striae distensae), with both clinical and histological evidence supporting its efficacy.
